com.esri.mo2.map.draw
Interface TextSymbol

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable, Symbol
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseTextSymbol
public interface TextSymbol
extends Symbol

Defines the characteristics of labels associated with a Map Layer. When a Map asks a Layer to render itself, the Layer invokes the TextSymbol prepare() method in order to prepare a label for each Feature found in the Layer. The Layer then arranges for the label to be added into the LabelEngine. Once the LabelEngine has determined optimal label placement, it arranges for the TextSymbol to render the corresponding label on a Map's LabelDisplay. The LabelDisplay and LabelEngine are obtainable from the Map's DisplayManager.

prepare

public void prepare(String text,
                    FeatureGeometry fg,
                    Transform transform)
a TextSymbol is asked to prepare a label for rendering. Normally, relevant details will be passed on to the LabelEngine

Parameters:
text - the label text
fg - the Feature Geometry
transform - the world coords -> pixel transform

draw

public void draw(String text,
                 double x,
                 double y,
                 double angle,
                 Graphics2D g,
                 FeatureGeometry fg)
this method is called by a Labeling to render a label. Rotation's pivot point is the center of the label point (x,y)

Parameters:
text - the label text
x - the x coordinate of the label text center
y - the y coordinate of the label text center
angle - the rotation angle in radians
g - the graphic context
fg - the feature location

setFeatureWeight

public void setFeatureWeight(int featureWeight)
the feature weight determines how important the rendering of a feature is compared with the rendering of its label. By setting this property, all labels for the current Layer are affected. Giving importance to features increasing the complexity of the labeling problem and also the processing time. The default FeatureWeight is LE_NO_WEIGHT

Parameters:
featureWeight - valid values are defined within the LabelEngine: LE_NO_WEIGHT LE_MED_WEIGHT LE_HIGH_WEIGHT
See Also:
LabelEngine.LE_NO_WEIGHT

getFeatureWeight

public int getFeatureWeight()
returns the feature weigh currently being used

See Also:
setFeatureWeight(int)

setLabelWeight

public void setLabelWeight(int labelWeight)
the label weight determines the importance of rendering a label compared with rendering the corresponding feature. The default LabelWeight is LE_HIGH_WEIGHT

See Also:
setFeatureWeight(int)

getLabelWeight

public int getLabelWeight()
returns the label weight currently used

See Also:
setFeatureWeight(int)

setLabelBufferRatio

public void setLabelBufferRatio(double labelBufferRatio)
This is the fraction of the height or the width(whichever is smaller) of the label rectangle to buffer the label rectangle width. A negative ratio will cause the label rectangle to become smaller than the label.

Parameters:
labelBufferRatio - buffer ratio

getLabelBufferRatio

public double getLabelBufferRatio()
returns the label buffer ratio

See Also:
setLabelBufferRatio(double)

setHowManyLabels

public void setHowManyLabels(int howManyLabels)
this property determines how many labels are to be drawn for multiple features and/or multi-part features. By setting this property, all labels for the current Layer are affected. The default value for howManyLabels is LE_ONE_LABEL_PER_NAME

Parameters:
howManyLabels - valid values are defined within the LabelEngine: LE_ONE_LABEL_PER_SHAPE LE_ONE_LABEL_PER_PART LE_ONE_LABEL_PER_NAME
See Also:
LabelEngine.LE_ONE_LABEL_PER_NAME

getHowManyLabels

public int getHowManyLabels()
returns the currently used value for HowManyLabels

See Also:
setHowManyLabels(int)

setLabelPriorities

public void setLabelPriorities(String stringPriorities)
Sets priorities for label location. There are nine possible label positions:
 1  2  3
 8  9  4
 7  6  5

You can prioritize the importance of each position from 0 upwards. 0 signifies that the label should not be placed in that position. 1 means that this is the most desireable position for the label. All higher numbers represent lesser priorities for that position. For example, "1,0,1,0,0,0,0,0" means that only the first and third label positions will be taken into account when labeling. In another example, "1,2,3,0,1,0,0,0" means try to label at the first and fifth position; if not, then put the label at the second position; if not, then put it at the third position; if this is not possible, then don't label it. The value "0,0,0,0,0,0,0,0,1" means LE_PlaceOnTopHorizontal.

Parameters:
stringPriorities - a comma delimeted list of priorities, like "2,2,1,4,5,3,2,4".

getLabelPriorities

public int[] getLabelPriorities()
returns the label priorities as integer array

See Also:
setLabelPriorities(java.lang.String)

getLabelPrioritiesAsString

public String getLabelPrioritiesAsString()
returns the label priorities as a string of parameters

setRotationalAngles

public void setRotationalAngles(String stringAngles)
this property is only applicable for Point features. The rotational angles are possible angles that the label can be placed relative to a labeled point. By default, only an angle of 0 degrees will be used to label the point. If a comma-delimited list of rotational angles is given, then the points, if needed, will also be labeled using that angle.

Parameters:
stringAngles - the string like "15,75,105,165". Up to 8 integer angles can be specified.

getRotationalAngles

public int[] getRotationalAngles()
get the rotational angles as integer array

See Also:
setRotationalAngles(java.lang.String)

getRotationalAnglesAsString

public String getRotationalAnglesAsString()
returns the rotational angles as a string of paremeters

setLineLabelPosition

public void setLineLabelPosition(int lineLabelPosition)
this property is only applicable for Line features. Determines where on a line to label, using one or more of the following identifiers that are defined within LabelEngine: PlaceNone - Do not place label.
PlaceAbove - Place above line.
PlaceBelow - Place below line.
PlaceOnTop - Place on top.
PlaceLeft - Place at left side of the line.
PlaceRight - Place at right side of the line.
PlaceAboveBelow - Place above or below
PlaceLeftRight - Place at either end of the line.
PlaceInLine - Place anywhere on line.
PlaceAtStart - Place at beginning of the line.
PlaceAtEnd - Place the end of the line.
PlaceAtEitherEnd - Place at beginning or end.
PlaceParallel - Place parallel.
PlacePerpendicular - Place perpendicular.
PlaceHoriziontal - Place gorizontal.
PlaceOnTopHorizontal - Place horizontal on top.
 Any combinations are possible by OR'ing the identifiers for example: PlaceAbove | PlaceRight

Parameters:
lineLabelPosition - the parameter can be set from BaseLabelEngine.LE_PLACE* etc

getLineLabelPosition

public int getLineLabelPosition()
get the lineLabelPosition parameter

See Also:
setLineLabelPosition(int)
